bioghist.p: Samuel Rhoads (1806-1868) was a publisher and editor of the Friends Review (1853-1867). His wife was Anne Gibbons. Their son, Edward Rhoads (1841-1871), was an 1859 graduate of Haverford College and received his M.D. from the University of Pennsylvania in 1863. He worked at Philadelphia Hospital. He was a conscientious objector during the Civil War. One of their other sons was William Gibbons Rhoads (1838-1880), who attended Haverford from 1854 to 1858. He was a machinist and plumber in Philadelphia. He was a Manager of Haverford College from 1871 to 1880. His wife was Sarah Wistar. Their son, Samuel Rhoads, Jr. (b. 1878), received his bachelor's degree from Haverford in 1898 and his M.D. from the University of Pennsylvania in 1901. He worked as a physician in Philadelphia. Their daughter was Lydia W. Rhoads.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of Rhoads family papers. Materials include: correspondence from Samuel Rhoads to his parents and friends while in England in 1834; letters between Samuel Rhoads and Anne Gibbons; letters to Anne Gibbons Rhoads; letters to Samuel Rhoads from friends concerning the Friends Review and issues related to meetings; letters from Edward Rhoads to his parents from his 1865-1866 trip to Europe and letters to him from family and friends; letters to Lydia W. Rhoads during her 1907 trip to England; correspondence between Sophia R. Wing and Jane Gibbons and letters to Sophia from Asa Wing. The collection also contains photographs, news clippings, copies of the Friends Review (including obituaries of Anne G. Rhoads, William G. Rhoads, and Jane Rhoads), diaries, receipts, a dues list of the Free Produce Association of Friends of Philadelphia Yearly Meeting, an account book belonging to Ethel Rhoads Potts, deeds and estate papers of Samuel Rhoads, and school compositions of William G. and Edward Rhoads.
